channel.title: Run.bat help?
channel.description:
Im helping my friend with a server.. and everytime he runs his run.bat he gets this..
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Bulby/Server Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Bulby.Server at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(Unknown Source) Could not find the main class: Bulby/Server. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . .
I helped him all i can, changing the classpaths etc etc.. but nothing is happening.. help?

item.title: Run.bat help?
item.description:
@11167 wrote:

[quote=“zerogordo, post:3, topic:286944”][quote author=Vic_ link=topic=379464.msg2853484#msg2853484 date=1246683879]
Compile All, if it comes up with some errors, fix them then it will work fine. [By the way, if the cmd pops up, it’s not the classpaths.]
[/quote]

if you click the batch file the cmd will always pop up you can tell if its classpaths you need to tell by the part if it says “the system cannot find the path” or whatever. but everything else is good

unless when you edited it you didnt use
“pause”
at the end[/quote]

Variables are not there, then you get the command not being recognized. If they are incorrectly referenced, then you get this error.
I will always ask this: why doesn’t anyone read the error? java.lang.ClassNotFoundException. What’s that say?

Read full topic

item.title: Run.bat help?
item.dc:creator: @Server_Creator_Brian Server Creator Brian
item.description:
@Server_Creator_Brian wrote:

thanks ill try it

Read full topic

item.title: Run.bat help?
item.dc:creator: @zerogordo zerogordo
item.description:
@zerogordo wrote:

Vic_:

Compile All, if it comes up with some errors, fix them then it will work fine. [By the way, if the cmd pops up, it’s not the classpaths.]

if you click the batch file the cmd will always pop up you can tell if its classpaths you need to tell by the part if it says “the system cannot find the path” or whatever. but everything else is good

unless when you edited it you didnt use
“pause”
at the end

Read full topic

@vic_08 wrote:

Compile All, if it comes up with some errors, fix them then it will work fine. [By the way, if the cmd pops up, it’s not the classpaths.]

Press any key to continue . . .
